channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Little Charo
channel.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. "I want to see my owner again!" Charo starts his adventure back home. Season 1-19.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: A Cat's Eye View Of Japan
channel.desc: On a hot summer's day, a kitty leads us to traditional food near a local shrine. Get cool in a maiko's home with another kitty before enjoying sparklers at night.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Ekiben Japan
channel.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a wide range of programs from news, current affairs, documentaries, etc. focusing on Japan and Asia.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Easy Japanese For Work
channel.desc: Today: checking that others have understood instructions. Shang Yan, from China, works as a train cleaner in Tokyo. To improve her skills as a team leader, she tackles a roleplay challenge.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Time Lapse Journey
channel.desc: Oze National Park contains the largest mountain wetland in Japan. See the beauty of Oze as time-lapse photography makes the flowers and the morning dew come alive.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Direct Talk
channel.desc: In 2020, Kitajima Masaaki published the world's first paper on how the spread of COVID-19 could be tracked by monitoring wastewater. He talks about making an impact on infectious disease control.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Easy Travel Japanese
channel.desc: #2 Sumimasen. A versatile word/ When traveling in Japan for the first time, what phrases do you need? 4 episodes provide simple expressions you can put to use as soon as you land.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Kaizoku: The Kurushima Straits
channel.desc: The Murakami Kaizoku were seafarers and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea. We explore their history and legacy, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time, the Kurushima Straits.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Magical Japanese
channel.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to the color red. Explore the unique culture behind them.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Culture Crossroads
channel.desc: Actor Fujiwara Momona has been a wheelchair user since childhood. In a society that tends to limit how people with disabilities live their lives, what world does this budding actor hope to build.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: 1/30: People With Mental Illness
channel.desc: 1 in 30 Japanese suffer from mental illness. We follow a woman who finds it hard to do simple tasks due to her illness, as she goes to rehabilitation for returning to work.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Herbal Symphony #1 Spring
channel.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Time Lapse Journey
channel.desc: Nikko, in Tochigi Prefecture, is home to much natural beauty with its great mountains and lakes. The ornate Nikko Toshogu Shrine is famous. See the widely beloved Nikko through time-lapse photography.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: Some craftspeople have broken traditional boundaries to develop products from materials or designs they had long possessed but hadn't been using.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Hometown Stories
channel.desc: Mito Kosei, 78, was exposed to radiation in the womb when an atomic bomb exploded over Hiroshima. For 20 years or so, he's been a volunteer guide, telling foreign visitors the truth about the bombing.

channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.title: Ramen Japan 5min.
channel.desc: Niigata is one of Japan's foremost ramen hotspots. Let's explore the diversity of the city's beloved ramen dishes.

channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: The Kawanishi Dainenbutsu Kenbai dance tells the story of restless souls being guided to the Pure Land by the Buddha, in the form of a monkey. In 2022, it became UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Seasoning The Seasons
channel.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Medical Frontiers
channel.desc: From prevention to cure! The groundbreaking world of Japanese medical technology and healthcare. For your healthy lifestyle, this program shows tips of superfoods and easy exercises.

channel.title: Cinematic Journey
channel.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a variety of short programs focusing on Japan and Asia.

channel.title: Where We Call Home
channel.desc: People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships they face in Japanese society.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: The Masterpieces Of Tsutaju
channel.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode features ukiyo-e artist Sharaku's "The Actor Ichikawa Ebizo as Takemura Sadanoshin.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: My Street Piano
channel.desc: Shibuya is one of Tokyo's largest cities. A piano is placed near a ticket gate at the station, and people stop to play from their heart.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Easy Japanese
channel.desc: #45 Would you check the Japanese in my email? / To politely ask someone to do something, use a "te" form verb and "moraemasen ka." For example, "chekku-shite moraemasen ka" (would you check?).

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Hello! Nhk World Japan
channel.desc: NHK WORLD PREMIUM, a service aimed at people outside of Japan, broadcasts programs and news in Japanese. We explain how to use it and introduce features like online streaming.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: Some craftspeople have broken traditional boundaries to develop products from materials or designs they had long possessed but hadn't been using.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Direct Talk
channel.desc: In 2024, Ishigami Junya received the prestigious Austrian Frederick Kiesler Prize for Architecture and the Arts. He talks about his groundbreaking work and ponders the meaning of architecture.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Ukiyoe Edo Life: Summer Light Show
channel.desc: We venture to the outskirts of Edo just after sunset, where a group of women and children have come to a stream to enjoy a popular summer activity. What could they be looking for among the weeds.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Message To The Future, Connecting Through The Power Of Song
channel.desc: NHK Hiroshima's theme song by PORNOGRAFFITTI, marking 80 years since the city was atomic bombed. Full of wishes and prayers for peace, it depicts a streetcar that ran three days after the bombing.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Passing The Torch Of Peace
channel.desc: Ari Beser's grandfather served on the planes that dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Harada Kosuzu's grandfather survived both. Now they are fighting for a world without nuclear weapons.

channel.title: Passing The Torch Of Peace
channel.desc: The key to achieving peace is feeling the pain of others. It's an idea Hayashida Mitsuhiro picked up from hibakusha in his native Nagasaki, and one he tries to teach young visitors to his city.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: Gataine Odori is a dance that depicts exhausting land reclamation work carried out in Omuta in the 19th century. A group of elderly women teach the dance to schoolchildren, and keep the story alive.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Dining With The Chef
channel.desc: In a Japanese home cooking class, Chef Saito makes pan-fried eggplant with a savory miso and sesame glaze. Paired with fine white somen noodles, this tasty summer dish is sure to whet your appetite.

channel.title: My Street Piano
channel.desc: Kumamoto is recovering from the 2016 earthquake. A piano is placed in a shopping arcade for a limited period, and people stop to play from their heart.

channel.desc: In a Japanese home cooking class, Chef Saito makes pan-fried eggplant with a savory miso and sesame glaze. Paired with fine white somen noodles, this tasty summer dish is sure to whet your appetite.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: This episode features business models designed to help Japan's hikikomori (individuals who have withdrawn from society) to socialize, learn, and even find employment.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Direct Talk
channel.desc: Muta Yoca is an artist whose vibrant, dynamic pieces are based on the Kutani-yaki style of ceramics. We speak with Muta about her global popularity and how she creates art unburdened by convention.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Ukiyoe Edo Life: Riverside Sawmill
channel.desc: Workers at a sawmill use the latest tools and their honed skills to prepare the building blocks of Edo life: long, narrow beams, bamboo stems and leftover wood stacked as high as buildings.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Document 72 Hours
channel.desc: Three days in the life of...Stay in one location for 72 hours, catching glimpses into people's lives as they open up and share.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: On New Year's Eve, performers dress as monsters called namahage. It's a good-natured tradition that strengthens family and community bonds. And in the village of Tayazawa, it was recently revived.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Science View
channel.desc: Tiny nematodes can survive in harsh environments, regenerate damaged tissue, and make decisions. They're being studied for hints about new medicines. We'll also look at recycled concrete.

channel.desc: This episode features business models designed to help Japan's hikikomori (individuals who have withdrawn from society) to socialize, learn, and even find employment.

channel.title: Deeper Look
channel.desc: An experienced anchor Del Irani has a cutting-edge dialogue with a first-class guest on a current-affairs topics.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Dining With The Chef Mini
channel.desc: Featured recipe: Spoon-molded Sushi. Learn about easy, delicious, and healthy cooking with Chef Rika in five minutes!

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Dive In Tokyo
channel.desc: We trace the ongoing evolution of the Daiba waterfront district, which began as defensive fortifications and transformed over time into a tourist destination, residential area, and innovation hub.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: The World Heritage Sites In Japan
channel.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Japan's Top Inventions
channel.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter. This time: smokeless grills.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: Clothing and household goods makers are offering a unique service that lets users make one-of-a-kind products. We look into how product customization can improve sales performance.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Frontrunners
channel.desc: FRONTRUNNERS highlights professionals at the very forefront of their field. We showcase their amazing work, discover their motivations, and learn about the challenges they face in the future.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Science View
channel.desc: Tiny nematodes can survive in harsh environments, regenerate damaged tissue, and make decisions. They're being studied for hints about new medicines. We'll also look at recycled concrete.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: Clothing and household goods makers are offering a unique service that lets users make one-of-a-kind products. We look into how product customization can improve sales performance.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Kabuki Kool
channel.desc: Chobei led a vigilante group to protect people from samurai abuses. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores him in two plays, one showing a fateful encounter and one showing his tragic death.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Cinematic Journey
channel.desc: Join our explorers as they pursue the cinematic beauty of Japan. Kyle Card hikes the newly designated long trail around majestic Mt. Fuji and discovers its secrets.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Dive In Tokyo
channel.desc: We trace the ongoing evolution of the Daiba waterfront district, which began as defensive fortifications and transformed over time into a tourist destination, residential area, and innovation hub.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: Clothing and household goods makers are offering a unique service that lets users make one-of-a-kind products. We look into how product customization can improve sales performance.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Direct Talk
channel.desc: The majority of Niger, in Africa, is occupied by the Sahara, and desertification is a major problem. Oyama Shuichi introduces his method of increasing vegetation using household waste.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: On The Wings 5min.
channel.desc: Join us on a night flight to admire Japan's stunning views on a journey from Tokyo to Fukuoka. Behold the sublime beauty of Mt. Fuji at sunset and the sparkling night views of major cities.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Kabuki Kool
channel.desc: Chobei led a vigilante group to protect people from samurai abuses. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores him in two plays, one showing a fateful encounter and one showing his tragic death.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Science View
channel.desc: Tiny nematodes can survive in harsh environments, regenerate damaged tissue, and make decisions. They're being studied for hints about new medicines. We'll also look at recycled concrete.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Cinematic Journey
channel.desc: Join our explorers as they pursue the cinematic beauty of Japan. Kyle Card hikes the newly designated long trail around majestic Mt. Fuji and discovers its secrets.

channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Direct Talk
channel.desc: Imoto Katsuyuki is working to promote financial independence among ethnic minorities in conflict-torn Myanmar by teaching them agriculture. He talks about what is needed to support them.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Ukiyoe Edo Life: First Childbirth
channel.desc: In the Edo period, childbirth was a community affair, with the mother-to-be attended by a midwife and the women in her life. It was also characterized by unique customs and superstitions.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: The World Heritage Sites In Japan
channel.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Japan's Top Inventions
channel.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter. This time: smokeless grills.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: My Street Piano
channel.desc: Hirosaki City in Aomori Prefecture is known for its Western architecture. A piano is placed inside the station, and people stop to play from their heart.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: One In Every Japanese
channel.desc: 1 in 1000 Japanese have experience as a lay judge in court cases. We witness a networking event for former lay judges, where they discuss unique experiences. What does it feel like to judge others.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: The highlight of Onabare is nerikomi, which involves the careful wielding of a long, heavy pole. This follows the parade of a portable shrine through the streets with performances along the way.

channel.title: Science View
channel.desc: Tiny nematodes can survive in harsh environments, regenerate damaged tissue, and make decisions. They're being studied for hints about new medicines. We'll also look at recycled concrete.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Passing The Torch Of Peace
channel.desc: A German playwright finds inspiration in a piano that survived the atomic bombing and its owner, who died after the blast at the age of 19, to create a piece warning against war's impact on the young.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Dive In Tokyo
channel.desc: We trace the ongoing evolution of the Daiba waterfront district, which began as defensive fortifications and transformed over time into a tourist destination, residential area, and innovation hub.

channel.title: Herbal Symphony #3 Autumn

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Core Kyoto
channel.desc: Iron kettles rust and corrode over time. For centuries metal casters specializing in kettles have cast diverse kettles for tea gatherings, creating a universe of infinite beauty within that corrosion.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: The World Heritage Sites In Japan
channel.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Time Lapse Japan: Izumo
channel.desc: Matsue is known as the "city of water." It is home to Lake Shinji, which is famous for its shijimi clams. Through beautiful time-lapse footage, we see the lake's changing colors and expressions.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: A wide range of construction-related businesses are taking in energy-efficient demolition methods that drastically reduce CO2 emissions.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Japanology Plus
channel.desc: Origami is the art of folding paper into a wide variety of shapes, from animals and flowers to highly complex designs. Lately, its principles have even been applied to space exploration and medicine.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: Onomichi Betcha is a three-day festival in Hiroshima Prefecture. Masked ogres carry sticks with which to "torment" spectators. But being hit or poked with a stick is said to bring good luck.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Trails To Oishii Tokyo
channel.desc: Rice flour is attracting global attention. After using it for ages to make sweets, Japan employs the latest milling tech to create rice flour for various uses. See how the powder continues to evolve.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Biz Stream
channel.desc: A wide range of construction-related businesses are taking in energy-efficient demolition methods that drastically reduce CO2 emissions.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Lunch On!
channel.desc: We visit a lacquer artisan rebuilding Shuri Castle in Okinawa, which was destroyed in a 2019 fire. He leads a team of young craftspeople, and for lunch, enjoys a delicious bento made by his wife.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Cinematic Journey
channel.desc: Join our explorers as they pursue the cinematic beauty of Japan. Kyle Card hikes the newly designated long trail around majestic Mt. Fuji and discovers its secrets.

channel.title: Direct Talk
channel.desc: Colon Erika is the artistic director of a choir for children with hearing and visual impairments. The group's aim is to make music accessible to all. She talks about developing a new form of music.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Ukiyoe Edo Life: Summer Delicacy
channel.desc: A group of anglers stand in a fast-moving, undulating river at the foot of a rugged cliff. They use "drifting mosquito hooks" to fish for a summer delicacy that was a favorite of the Edo townspeople.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: One In Every Japanese
channel.desc: 1 in 2 don't drink in Japan, where intense social drinking is normal. Through interviews of drinkers and non-drinkers we hear both sides, including a couple who went sober and opened a no-alcohol bar.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
channel.desc: Kagura is a form of votive music and dance that started over a thousand years ago. Akitakata in Hiroshima Prefecture has a hall dedicated to year-round kagura performances, and 22 kagura troupes.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Hometown Stories
channel.desc: Mito Kosei, 78, was exposed to radiation in the womb when an atomic bomb exploded over Hiroshima. For 20 years or so, he's been a volunteer guide, telling foreign visitors the truth about the bombing.

channel.title: Japanology Plus

channel.desc: Across the country, Japan's railways are working towards a shared goal: carbon neutrality. See the efforts being made to shift away from diesel power and to improve energy efficiency overall.

channel.title: The Beauty Of Japanese Swords
channel.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a blade wielded by Miyamoto Musashi, the world's most famous swordsman: Musashi Masamune.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.
